title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:51 <DrLou> has quit  
07:12 <amon> Interesting... WYSIWYG editing does not seem to work very well with lines containing links. If I cut a line with a link to an uploaded file and paste it elsewhere, it does not seem to work afterwards... in fact it seems quite screwed up. Probably have to delete the link and regen it...  
07:24 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <amon> Looking at it in 'source' I found the lines I moved had their 'attach' changed to http. Fixed one of them by editing but repairing the other still seems to be evading me...  
07:37 <amon> This is going to be messy for people who are writers and not computer systems folk.  
08:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <vmassol> good morning  
09:44 <vmassol> hmmm I wonder how thomas is going to be the build manager for this week when he's on holidays....  
09:45 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <vmassol> hmm lots of failing tests…. several due to sergiu and marta's changes over the week end I believe  
09:47 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <vmassol> has quit  
10:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <vmassol> has quit  
10:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'm unable to deploy a jar to maven.xwiki.org externals. I have this on my pom http://pastebin.com/YpsipwxU and my setting.xml has http://pastebin.com/1ZtNMnQK . When I mvn clean deploy I'm being asked for the password for [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) . I can ssh [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) . Is there something I'm missing?  
10:52 <vmassol> I don't know, I haven't done it but sergiu released 3.2M2 so it should be working  
10:52 <vmassol> have you tried doing a manual scp to see if it works?  
10:52 <vmassol> have you enabled -X to see what happens?  
10:52 <+mflorea> let me try  
11:08 <+mflorea> vmassol: I can scp and the -X output doesn't say much http://pastebin.com/GA1jcREx . It's clearly a maven configuration issue.  
11:11 <vmassol> mflorea: can you try to pass the user?  
11:11 <vmassol> hmm apparently it's not possible:  
11:12 <vmassol> it shouldn't be needed anyway  
11:12 <vmassol> the ids are correct?  
11:12 <vmassol> yes they look ok  
11:37 <+mflorea> vmassol: I don't get it, it works with scpexe and wagon-ssh-external :| but not with scp and wagon-ssh  
11:37 <+mflorea> http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-deploy-plugin/examples/deploy-ssh-external.html  
11:38 <vmassol> scp exe will use your scp executable  
11:38 <vmassol> it's normal it's working  
11:38 <vmassol> since you said you could scp manually  
11:38 <+mflorea> yes, but why isn't scp + wagon-ssh working?  
11:38 <vmassol> scp will use a java implementation of scp  
11:38 <vmassol> and the issue is finding your username/key/password  
11:39 <+mflorea> I see  
11:39 <vmassol> I don't know why though  
11:39 <+mflorea> it should find the access config in settings.xml  
11:39 <+mflorea> anyway, moving forward sine I don't have time to investigate more  
12:23 <vmassol> mflorea: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/460/  
12:24 <vmassol> 505 failures! nice score :)  
12:48 <+mflorea> vmassol: there's no relation between annotations and my commit (office importer)  
12:49 <+mflorea> wait  
12:49 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <+mflorea> strange, tests pass locally  
12:58 <vmassol> as you can see in the tests there's a component init issue  
12:59 <+mflorea> yes, but I don't have it locally  
12:59 <+mflorea> can you pull and build office importer locally to check?  
12:59 <vmassol> it doesn't matter if it build on my machine, it needs to work on the ci one  
12:59 <vmassol> (and I'm having lunch right now… :))  
13:00 <+mflorea> sure, but it helps to understand the problem  
13:00 <+mflorea> ok  
13:05 <@cjdelisle> good morning (afternoont)  
13:05 <@cjdelisle> s/t//  
13:59 <pturcotte> has quit  
14:08 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
14:54 <+mflorea> vmassol: we still have problems with nexus, http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-container-api/3.2-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml is inaccessible.  
14:54 <+mflorea> same http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-bridge/3.2-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml  
14:54 <+mflorea> http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-refactoring/3.2-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml  
14:55 <@cjdelisle> http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-core-container-api/  
14:55 <+mflorea> http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-gallery/3.2-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml  
14:55 <@cjdelisle> it only seems to go up to 3.0  
14:55 <@cjdelisle> it was probably moved  
14:56 <+mflorea> that's a different issue, the real problem is that maven-metadata.xml is protected  
14:56 <@cjdelisle> indeed  
14:56 <@cjdelisle> http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-container-api/3.2-SNAPSHOT/  
14:57 <@cjdelisle> lets see if I can find anything...  
14:57 <+mflorea> and it's not the same for all artifacts  
14:58 <+mflorea> maven-metadata.xml is accessible for most of them  
15:05 <@cjdelisle> I don't think it's a case of being protected, it seems to be a real 404 error  
15:06 <+mflorea> but it is listed  
15:06 <@cjdelisle> indeed, perhaps the disk drive is full or it was dropped?  
15:06 <+mflorea> the maven-metadata.xml file  
15:08 <@cjdelisle> ahh it's the maven box...  
15:09 <@cjdelisle> disk drive 88% used  
15:10 <@cjdelisle> maven@maven:~/public\_html/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-container-api/3.2-SNAPSHOT$ ls -la maven-metadata.xml  
15:11 <@cjdelisle> -rw-rw-r-- 1 maven maven 796 2011-08-22 14:45 maven-metadata.xml  
15:12 <+mflorea> yes, http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-container-api/3.2-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml is accessible, but http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-container-api/3.2-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml not  
15:13 <+mflorea> I don't know how nexus works. Isn't Nexus using the same repo? I though Nexus is just a layer on top of a maven repo  
15:14 <+mflorea> why is Nexus blocking access to a file from maven repo?..  
15:15 <@cjdelisle> I think that is how it is configured but it might be mirroring it, checking in to it more...  
15:17 <@cjdelisle> hrm  
15:20 <+mflorea> I found this http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Re-Item-not-found-for-UID-message-for-SNAPSHOT-artifacts-on-Solaris-td130685.html  
15:22 <+mflorea> it might be a problem with Nexus cache and the way we deploy maven artifacts.  
15:30 <+mflorea> there is also https://issues.sonatype.org/browse/NEXUS-3601  
15:31 <+mflorea> one of the questions was: "is your Hudson deploying to Nexus over HTTP? Or directly to FS that backs Nexus storage?"  
15:35 <+mflorea> I see that xwiki-commons pom uses maven.xwiki.org in its distribution management section, this suggests that releases are not deployed through nexus, but directly on maven.xwiki.org  
15:37 <@cjdelisle> indeed, it should be pushing to nexus otherwise the cache will not be cleared.  
15:37 <+mflorea> yep  
15:38 <+mflorea> but that is for releases, the issue we have now is with snapshot. I'm trying to find the place where jenkins is told where to deploy snapshots  
15:38 <@cjdelisle> it's in the pom.xml  
15:39 <+mflorea> so it's the same as for releases then  
15:39 <+mflorea> jenkins deploys directly to maven.xwiki.org  
15:44 <+mflorea> let me try deploying through nexus  
15:45 <@cjdelisle> the problem is you need to have an http password  
15:46 <+mflorea> yep, because I need to use http put, not scp (backed by my ssh key)  
15:46 <@cjdelisle> I got around this for the staging so it can be done, I just need to remember how I did it...  
15:48 <+mflorea> vmassol: help needed  
15:50 <@cjdelisle> ok agent1 has a password in the settings.xml and it's pwn username  
15:50 <@cjdelisle> we just need to add usernames/passwords for the other 3 agents and change the deploy method to http  
15:53 <+mflorea> yes, and all committers needs to update their settings.xml  
15:54 <+mflorea> we need to update http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleaseProcess too  
15:54 <@cjdelisle> no because committers shouldn't be pushing to the repo  
15:54 <+mflorea> you need to do it sometimes  
15:55 <+mflorea> at least for external deps  
15:55 <+mflorea> for instance I have to deploy a custom build of jodconverter to externals  
15:55 <@cjdelisle> For special cases you can add artifacts to maven manually then flush the cache if need be.  
15:56 <+mflorea> I see  
15:56 <+mflorea> I guess that will work  
15:56 <@cjdelisle> If you need to push things to nexus periodically then IMO you should have a username with it.  
15:57 <+mflorea> but this means we'll do the release only from the hudson machine, and I remember vincent complaining about it.  
15:57 <+mflorea> well, he actually complained that we use the same username to access the machine  
16:01 <@cjdelisle> yea it's kind of a catch22, it would be nice to have a username per committer per machine, then that would mean a lot of users with nexus...  cjdelisle-agent1 cjdelisle-agent2 etc etc etc.  
16:02 <+mflorea> yep..  
16:12 <vmassol> back  
16:12 <vmassol> yes we could decide to at last use staging as we should be using  
16:12 <vmassol> and then promote from staging to our release repo  
16:12 <vmassol> re externals, nexus has the UI to upload an artifact  
16:13 <vmassol> all that said I'm not sure about the "cache" issue you mention  
16:13 <vmassol> (I haven't read on it though so I'm not sure how that works)  
16:14 <+mflorea> right now we're deploying snapshots to maven.xwiki.org instead of doing it through nexus  
16:14 <vmassol> we don't have to go through nexus AFAIK  
16:14 <@cjdelisle> I think what's happening is when an artifact is build on an agent other than agent1 it doesn't use the http upload, it uses scp because I forgot to add the http upload to commons pom.xml and only added it to agent1's properties.xml.  
16:14 <vmassol> I don't see why we would have to do that  
16:15 <@cjdelisle> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1584763/how-do-i-deploy-to-nexus-hosted-by-secureci  
16:15 <@cjdelisle> "Having that said, I don't think that scp is the way to go with Nexus. If you deploy using scp, Nexus won't be notified of the deployment and your artifacts won't be visible"  
16:19 <@cjdelisle> ahh nope agent1 is using scp too, it only uses http for staging.  
16:19 <vmassol> I don't know how often nexus refreshed its cache  
16:20 <vmassol> s/refreshed/refreshes/  
16:20 <@cjdelisle> it's set to 1440 minutes  
16:20 <vmassol> hmm you sure it's the right setting? I thought it was the remote repo sync setting  
16:20 <vmassol> hecking  
16:21 <vmassol> yes it could be the same setting  
16:22 <vmassol> in any case this is configurable  
16:22 <vmassol> and we could lower the value for repos hosted on the FS  
16:23 <vmassol> reading http://www.sonatype.com/books/nexus-book/reference/config-sect-manage-repo.html  
16:23 <vmassol> indeed  
16:23 <vmassol> "If Nexus fails to locate an artifact, it will cache this result for a given number of minutes. In other words, if Nexus can't find an artifact in a remote repository, it will not repeated attempt to resolve this artifact until the Not Found Cache TTL time has been exceeded. The default for this setting is 1440 minutes (or 24 hours)."  
16:23 <vmassol> should we put 1 minute?  
16:24 <vmassol> for the snapshot repo  
16:24 <vmassol> xwiki snapshot repo I mean  
16:24 <vmassol> done  
16:25 <+mflorea> let's see how it works  
16:25 <@cjdelisle> My thinking is this: "If you don't want surprises from nexus then don't surprise nexus by chainging things on it's filesystem."  
16:25 <vmassol> we have quite a lot of exceptions in nexus logs btw  
16:26 <vmassol> cjdelisle: it's a good thinking but we need to agree all together first that we want to do all our repo operations through nexus  
16:27 <@cjdelisle> FWIW I'm +1 to the idea, I'd like it better if it was FOSS software but it's usefull and that is good. OTOH if we can put this off then we can get myxwiki updated sooner :)  
16:28 <vmassol> yep  
16:29 <@cjdelisle> I can start looking at that as soon as my key is on the box.  
16:30 <vmassol> mflorea: did you fix the platform test issue btw?  
16:30 <vmassol> (was it related to this discussion?)  
16:31 <+mflorea> yes, it was related. I cleared my local repo to see if I can reproduce the ci behavior but then I couldn't build because of the nexus issue  
16:31 <+mflorea> let me try again  
16:32 <vmassol> there's a pb on nexus right now  
16:32 <vmassol> mflorea: what do you want to do?  
16:32 <vmassol> you want to redeploy?  
16:32 <vmassol> I don't think this is necessary  
16:33 <vmassol> (oops sorry was reading some old messages from above)  
16:33 <+mflorea> no, I wanted to see if the tests pass locally because maven uses artifacts from my local repo  
16:33 <+mflorea> so cleared my local repo and rebuild office importer  
16:33 <+mflorea> but then I hit th nexus problem  
16:35 <+mflorea> which I still have it seems, because some artifacts are not found. If you change the Not Found Cache TTL time to 1 minute it should work.  
16:35 <+mflorea> s/change/changed  
16:35 <+mflorea> is the new setting applied right away?  
16:38 <vmassol> btw we should upgrade our nexus version  
16:43 <vmassol> mflorea: btw there's this warning in the nexus log: http://pastebin.com/BGynxcB3  
16:44 <+mflorea> I don't get it, what could be wrong with gallery macro?  
16:45 <@cjdelisle> https://issues.sonatype.org/browse/NEXUS-3776  
16:45 <+mflorea> fixed in 1.8, what version are we using?  
16:45 <vmassol> 1.7.0  
16:47 <vmassol> I have access to nexus enteprrise 1.9.2 download  
16:47 <vmassol> and we have a valid license  
16:47 <vmassol> so all we need are the rights on the machine + the knowledge to perform an upgrade  
16:47 <vmassol> http://nexus.sonatype.org/upgrading-nexus.html  
16:48 <vmassol> in 1.9.2 I see: [NEXUS-4218] - Suppress generation of maven 3 metadata when older maven versions are detected  
16:48 <vmassol> http://nexus.sonatype.org/change-history.html  
16:51 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
17:04 <Chami1> has left #xwiki  
18:07 <obiwlan\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:10 <obiwlan\_\_> has quit  
18:12 <mflorea> has quit  
18:22 <vmassol> trying to upgrade nexus  
18:31 <arkub> has quit  
18:45 <vmassol> ok nexus updated to 1.9.2 (thanks jvelociter for your root access ;))  
18:46 <vmassol> cjdelisle: we can now access http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-container-api/3.2-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml  
18:47 <+jvelociter> yw  
18:50 <@cjdelisle> cool, except it probably happened because it flushed the cache when it updated but we'll just have to watch it.  
18:51 <vmassol> yes  
18:52 <@cjdelisle> I'm ready to upgrade myxwiki any time, just need my key installed.  
18:52 <vmassol> should I set you up or is someone else supposed to do that?  
18:53 <@cjdelisle> Nobody else told me they were going to.  
18:53 <vmassol> ok I'll add your key  
18:59 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I'm wondering if we should wait for 3.2M3 for myxwiki.org instead  
18:59 <vmassol> OTOH we definitely need to upgrade xwiki.org  
19:00 <@cjdelisle> Hey if we can put off 2 projects in one day then I won't argue with that :)  
19:00 <vmassol> why 2? :)  
19:01 <@cjdelisle> I was getting ready to change over the upload to use nexus http.  
19:01 <@cjdelisle> s/upload/snapshort pushing/  
19:01 <vmassol> ah ok  
19:01 <vmassol> so 2 indeed  
19:15 <vmassol> the build is still not building  
19:15 <vmassol> moving thomas as build manager  
19:15 <vmassol> I have no clue why he stepped forward knowing he's on holidays....  
19:15 <vmassol> s/moving/removing/  
19:16 <vmassol> any volunteer (I put myself ATM)  
19:18 <vmassol> has quit  
19:20 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
19:20 <vmassol> rebuilding locally to see if I can reproduce  
19:54 <jylebleu> has joined #xwiki  
19:57 <sburjan`> has quit  
20:19 <amon> I'm in the midst of trying to get a second proposal template out by 16:30... I cut and pasted my first proposal to the new wiki page... and none of the images survived. I've tried fiddling with the Source but have not found the magic.  
20:21 <amon> I am beginning to think that you cannot edit or move any sort of link on xwiki without deleting it and recreating it (and downloading) from scratch...  
20:22 <amon> \*amon listens to the reverberations in the empty meeting hall...  
20:23 <amon> Guess I have no choice but to do that then. Delete them all, re download all the image attachments and regnerate the links. Not good.  
20:24 <amon> Got a deadline to meet... bfn  
20:41 <jvelociter> has quit  
20:41 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
21:08 <jylebleu> Hi all, trying to install xwiki, what is the default username for admin, tried Admin/admin but does not seem to work  
21:10 <@cjdelisle> What type of installation are you using? the xip/exe or the .war?  
21:10 <jylebleu> .war  
21:10 <jylebleu> on tomcat 6  
21:10 <jylebleu> debian squeeze  
21:10 <@cjdelisle> Have you imported the .xar file yet?  
21:11 <jylebleu> no I thought you have to login as admin first  
21:11 <@cjdelisle> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HInstallingtheDefaultWikiXAR  
21:12 <@cjdelisle> nope, the user Admin is a document containing an object of type XWikiUsers and that document is bundled in the .xar.  
21:12 <jylebleu> ok thank you I did not understand that ... sorry  
21:14 <@cjdelisle> no problem, perhaps we should make that more clear  
21:14 <jylebleu> No I think I need to read the doc more carefully :) thks for your help  
21:39 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
21:39 <abusenius> has quit  
21:39 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
22:53 <RenJuan> has joined #xwiki  
22:54 <RenJuan> when $msg.get("name.subname") is executed, where is the value gotten from?  
22:56 <@cjdelisle> there is a file called ApplicationResources.properties and it is inside of xwiki-platform-legact-core-<someversion>.jar  
22:57 <RenJuan> so  ApplicationResources.properties is in xwiki-platform-legact-core-<someversion>.jar ?  
22:57 <jvelociter\_> has joined #xwiki  
22:58 <RenJuan> and the gotten data element is stored in the jar?  
22:59 <@cjdelisle> yes it is in the /resources/ in the jar  
22:59 <@cjdelisle> what version do you have? that file recently changed names  
22:59 <jvelociter> has quit  
22:59 <jvelociter\_> is now known as <jvelociter>  
22:59 <RenJuan> 3.1  
22:59 <@cjdelisle> \*the jar  
23:00 <@cjdelisle> ok it's called xwiki-platform-oldcore I think  
23:00 <RenJuan> so if the value is updated the jar is too?  
23:00 <@cjdelisle> no you can override it using translation bundles.  
23:00 <RenJuan> so the value can't be updated, it's read only?  
23:01 <@cjdelisle> IIRC it can be overwritten by adding a translation bundle and if you really want to change it, you can open the jar and modify the file.  
23:02 <@cjdelisle> \*overridden  
23:02 <RenJuan> thanks  
23:05 <RenJuan> cjdelisle, is there documentation someplace I missed that explains that, even at a high level?  
23:08 <RenJuan> \*very high level  
23:09 <jylebleu> has left #xwiki  
23:09 <@cjdelisle> there is this: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications  
23:10 <@cjdelisle> and you might find some information here: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10N/  
23:11 <pturcotte> has quit  
23:14 <RenJuan> thanks  
23:22 <abusenius> has quit  
23:26 <RenJuan> looks like for the particular item I was looking for its origin is in Translations.xml not the properties file  
23:26 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
23:29 <RenJuan> in xwiki-platform-wiki-manager/xwiki-platform-wiki-manager-ui/src/main/resources/WikiResources/Translations.xml  
23:30 <RenJuan> so maybe in this case the original coding was done in a lang other than English and the English default comes from the translation?  
23:31 <@cjdelisle> ahh yup that's one of the document bundles I was referring to  
23:31 <@cjdelisle> you should find a Document in your wiki called  WikiResources.Translations  
23:33 <RenJuan> no there doesn't appear to be such a file in the 3.1 wiki I'm focused on  
23:34 <vmassol> has quit  
23:34 <RenJuan>  find . -name "WikiResources.Translations" at least in the root doesn't find it.  
23:36 <@cjdelisle> nope, get into your wiki and goto /bin/view/WikiResources/Translations  
23:41 <RenJuan> there's no bin directory of any kind  
23:42 <@cjdelisle> have you been using the wiki?  
23:42 <@cjdelisle> yours, the one you setup...  
23:42 <RenJuan> yes, xem 3.1 standalone  
23:43 <@cjdelisle> in the browser, /bin/view/.... goes in the location bar  
23:44 <RenJuan> that worked  
23:45 <RenJuan> thx  
23:47 <RenJuan> so if I understand correctly the approach is almost everything can be done in the wiki or in one of the scripting languages  
23:48 <RenJuan> then there's the quantum drop to the java level to change base function if you need to  
23:51 <@cjdelisle> Yes, everything can be done from inside of the wiki  
23:52 <RenJuan> nice  
23:52 <@cjdelisle> Sensitive internal functions can be accessed from scripting as long as your script has so called "programming rights"  
23:53 <@cjdelisle> The IRC bot over there, xwikibot, that is a groovy script running inside of xwiki.org
